profiles.name: acme-inspec-profile
profiles.title: Meta profile for Acme Inc
profiles.summary: This profile collects all compliance and security related requirements for Acme Inc.

controls.title: Trusted hosts login
controls.desc: hosts.equiv file is a weak implemenation of authentication. Disabling the hosts.equiv support helps to prevent users from subverting the system's normal access control mechanisms of the system.

controls.title: Check owner and permissions for /etc/shadow
controls.desc: Check periodically the owner and permissions for /etc/shadow

controls.title: Check owner and permissions for /etc/passwd
controls.desc: Check periodically the owner and permissions for /etc/passwd

controls.title: Dot in PATH variable
controls.desc: Do not include the current working directory in PATH variable. This makes it easier for an attacker to gain extensive rigths by executing a Trojan program

controls.title: Check login.defs
controls.desc: Check owner and permissions for login.defs. Also check the configured PATH variable and umask in login.defs

controls.title: Check login.defs - RedHat specific
controls.desc: Check owner and permissions for login.defs. Also check the configured PATH variable and umask in login.defs

controls.title: Check for SUID/ SGID blacklist
controls.desc: Find blacklisted SUID and SGID files to ensure that no rogue SUID and SGID files have been introduced into the system

controls.title: Unique uid and gid
controls.desc: Check for unique uids gids

controls.title: Entropy
controls.desc: Check system has enough entropy - greater than 1000

controls.title: Check for .rhosts and .netrc file
controls.desc: Find .rhosts and .netrc files - CIS Benchmark 9.2.9-10

controls.title: CIS: Disable unused filesystems
controls.desc: 1.1.1 Ensure mounting of cramfs, freevxfs, jffs2, hfs, hfsplus, squashfs, udf, FAT

controls.title: Protect log-directory
controls.desc: The log-directory /var/log should belong to root

controls.title: Do not run deprecated inetd or xinetd
controls.desc: http://www.nsa.gov/ia/_files/os/redhat/rhel5-guide-i731.pdf, Chapter 3.2.1

controls.title: Do not install Telnet server
controls.desc: Telnet protocol uses unencrypted communication, that means the password and other sensitive data are unencrypted. http://www.nsa.gov/ia/_files/os/redhat/rhel5-guide-i731.pdf, Chapter 3.2.2

controls.title: Do not install rsh server
controls.desc: The r-commands suffers same problem as telnet. http://www.nsa.gov/ia/_files/os/redhat/rhel5-guide-i731.pdf, Chapter 3.2.3

controls.title: Do not install ypserv server (NIS)
controls.desc: Network Information Service (NIS) has some security design weaknesses like inadequate protection of important authentication information. http://www.nsa.gov/ia/_files/os/redhat/rhel5-guide-i731.pdf, Chapter 3.2.4

controls.title: Do not install tftp server
controls.desc: tftp-server provides little security http://www.nsa.gov/ia/_files/os/redhat/rhel5-guide-i731.pdf, Chapter 3.2.5

controls.title: Install syslog server package
controls.desc: Syslog server is required to receive system and applications logs

controls.title: Install auditd
controls.desc: auditd provides extended logging capabilities on recent distributions

controls.title: CIS: Additional process hardening
controls.desc: 1.5.4 Ensure prelink is disabled

controls.title: IPv4 Forwarding
controls.desc: If you're not intending for your system to forward traffic between interfaces, or if you only have a single interface, the forwarding function must be disable.

controls.title: Reverse path filtering
controls.desc: The rp_filter can reject incoming packets if their source address doesn't match the network interface that they're arriving on, which helps to prevent IP spoofing.

controls.title: ICMP ignore bogus error responses
controls.desc: Sometimes routers send out invalid responses to broadcast frames. This is a violation of RFC 1122 and the kernel will logged this. To avoid filling up your logfile with unnecessary stuff, you can tell the kernel not to issue these warnings

controls.title: ICMP echo ignore broadcasts
controls.desc: Blocking ICMP ECHO requests to broadcast addresses

controls.title: ICMP ratelimit
controls.desc: icmp_ratelimit defines how many packets that match the icmp_ratemask per second

controls.title: ICMP ratemask
controls.desc: Ratemask is a logical OR of all ICMP codes to rate limit

controls.title: TCP timestamps
controls.desc: It is possible to estimate the current uptime of a Linux system. It's preferable to disable TCP timestamps on your systems.

controls.title: ARP ignore
controls.desc: Reply only if the target IP address is local address configured on the incoming interface.

controls.title: ARP announce
controls.desc: Always use the best local address for this target. In this mode we ignore the source address in the IP packet and try to select local address that we prefer for talks with	the target host.

controls.title: TCP RFC1337 Protect Against TCP Time-Wait
controls.desc: This enables a fix for time-wait assassination hazards in tcp, described in RFC 1337. If enabled, this causes the kernel to drop RST packets for sockets in the time-wait state.

controls.title: Protection against SYN flood attacks
controls.desc: A SYN-Attack is a denial of service (DoS) attack that consumes resources on your system forcing you to reboot.

controls.title: Shared Media IP Architecture
controls.desc: Send(router) or accept(host) RFC1620 shared media redirects. If it is not set the kernel does not assume that different subnets on this device can communicate directly.

controls.title: Disable Source Routing
controls.desc: The accept_source_route option causes network interfaces to accept packets with the Strict Source Route (SSR) or Loose Source Routing (LSR) option set. An attacker is able to send a source routed packet into the network, then he could intercept the replies and your server might not know that it is not communicating with a trusted server

controls.title: Disable acceptance of all IPv4 redirected packets
controls.desc: Disable acceptance of all redirected packets these prevents Man-in-the-Middle attacks.

controls.title: Disable acceptance of all secure redirected packets
controls.desc: Disable acceptance of all secure redirected packets these prevents Man-in-the-Middle attacks.

controls.title: Disable sending of redirects packets
controls.desc: Disable sending of redirects packets

controls.title: Disable log martians
controls.desc: log_martians can cause a denial of service attack to the host

controls.title: Disable IPv6 if it is not needed
controls.desc: Disable IPv6 if it is not needed

controls.title: IPv6 Forwarding
controls.desc: If you're not intending for your system to forward traffic between interfaces, or if you only have a single interface, the forwarding function must be disable.

controls.title: Disable acceptance of all IPv6 redirected packets
controls.desc: Disable acceptance of all redirected packets these prevents Man-in-the-Middle attacks.

controls.title: Disable acceptance of IPv6 router solicitations messages
controls.desc: The router solicitations setting determines how many router solicitations are sent when bringing up the interface. If addresses are statically assigned, there is no need to send any solicitations.

controls.title: Disable Accept Router Preference from router advertisement
controls.desc: Disable Accept Router Preference from router advertisement

controls.title: Disable learning Prefix Information from router advertisement
controls.desc: The accept_ra_pinfo setting controls whether the system will accept prefix info from the router.

controls.title: Disable learning Hop limit from router advertisement
controls.desc: The accept_ra_defrtr setting controls whether the system will accept Hop Limit settings from a router advertisement. Setting it to 0 prevents a router from changing your default IPv6 Hop Limit for outgoing packets.

controls.title: Disable the system`s acceptance of router advertisement
controls.desc: Setting controls whether the system will accept router advertisement

controls.title: Disable IPv6 autoconfiguration
controls.desc: The autoconf setting controls whether router advertisements can cause the system to assign a global unicast address to an interface.

controls.title: Disable neighbor solicitations to send out per address
controls.desc: The dad_transmits setting determines how many neighbor solicitations to send out per address (global and link-local) when bringing up an interface to ensure the desired address is unique on the network.

controls.title: Assign one global unicast IPv6 addresses to each interface
controls.desc: The max_addresses setting determines how many global unicast IPv6 addresses can be assigned to each interface. The default is 16, but it should be set to exactly the number of statically configured global addresses required.

controls.title: Disable loading kernel modules
controls.desc: The sysctl key kernel.modules_disabled is very straightforward. If it contains a "1" it will disable loading new modules, where a "0" will still allow loading them. Using this option will be a great protection against loading malicious kernel modules.

controls.title: Magic SysRq
controls.desc: Kernel.sysreg is a 'magical' key combo you can hit which the kernel will respond to regardless of whatever else it is doing, unless it is completely locked up.

controls.title: Secure Core Dumps - dump settings
controls.desc: Ensure that core dumps can never be made by setuid programs

controls.title: Secure Core Dumps - dump path
controls.desc: Ensure that core dumps are done with fully qualified path

controls.title: kernel.randomize_va_space
controls.desc: kernel.randomize_va_space

controls.title: CPU No execution Flag or Kernel ExecShield
controls.desc: Kernel features and CPU flags provide a protection against buffer overflows. The CPU NX Flag and the kernel parameter exec-shield prevents code execution on a per memory page basis. If the CPU supports the NX-Flag then this should be used instead of the kernel parameter exec-shield.

controls.title: client: Check ssh_config owner, group and permissions.
controls.desc: The ssh_config should owned by root, only be writable by owner and readable to all.

controls.title: Client: Specify the AddressFamily to your need
controls.desc: OpenSSH should be configured to the network family. Set it to inet if you use IPv4 only. For IPv6 only set it to inet6.

controls.title: Client: Specify expected ssh port
controls.desc: Always specify which port the SSH client should connect. Prevent unexpected settings.

controls.title: Client: Specify protocol version 2
controls.desc: Only SSH protocol version 2 connections should be permitted. Version 1 of the protocol contains security vulnerabilities. Don't use legacy insecure SSHv1 connections anymore.

controls.title: Client: Disable batch mode
controls.desc: Avoid batch mode in the default configuration.

controls.title: Client: Check Host IPs
controls.desc: Make sure that SSH checks the host IP address in the known_hosts file, to avoid DNS spoofing effects.

controls.title: Client: Ask when checking host keys
controls.desc: Don't automatically add new hosts keys to the list of known hosts.

controls.title: Client: Check for secure ssh ciphers
controls.desc: Configure a list of ciphers to the best secure ciphers (avoid older and weaker ciphers)

controls.title: Client: Check for secure ssh Key-Exchange Algorithm
controls.desc: Configure a list of Key-Exchange Algorithms (Kexs) to the best secure Kexs (avoid older and weaker Key-Exchange Algorithm)

controls.title: Client: Check for secure ssh Message Authentication Codes
controls.desc: Configure a list of Message Authentication Codes (MACs) to the best secure MACs (avoid older and weaker Message Authentication Codes)

controls.title: Client: Disable agent forwarding
controls.desc: Prevent agent forwarding by default, as it can be used in a limited way to enable attacks.

controls.title: Client: Disable X11Forwarding
controls.desc: Prevent X11 forwarding by default, as it can be used in a limited way to enable attacks.

controls.title: Client: Disable HostbasedAuthentication
controls.desc: This option is a weak way for authentication and provide attacker more ways to enter the system.

controls.title: Client: Disable rhosts-based authentication
controls.desc: Avoid rhosts-based authentication, as it opens more ways for an attacker to enter a system.

controls.title: Client: Enable RSA authentication
controls.desc: Make sure RSA authentication is used by default.

controls.title: Client: Disable password-based authentication
controls.desc: Avoid password-based authentications.

controls.title: Client: Disable GSSAPIAuthentication
controls.desc: If you do not use GSSAPI authentication then disable it.

controls.title: Client: Disable GSSAPIDelegateCredentials
controls.desc: If you do not use GSSAPI authentication then disable it.

controls.title: Client: Disable tunnels
controls.desc: Avoid using SSH tunnels.

controls.title: Client: Do not permit local commands
controls.desc: Do not permit any local command execution.

controls.title: Client: Do not allow Roaming
controls.desc: Workaround for SSH Client Bug CVE-2016-0777 and CVE-2016-0778

controls.title: Server: Check for secure ssh ciphers
controls.desc: Configure a list of ciphers to the best secure ciphers (avoid older and weaker ciphers)

controls.title: Server: Check for secure ssh Key-Exchange Algorithm
controls.desc: Configure a list of Key-Exchange Algorithms (Kexs) to the best secure Kexs (avoid older and weaker Key-Exchange Algorithm)

controls.title: Server: Check for secure ssh Message Authentication Codes
controls.desc: Configure a list of Message Authentication Codes (MACs) to the best secure MACs (avoid older and weaker Message Authentication Codes)

controls.title: Server: Check SSH folder owner, group and permissions.
controls.desc: The SSH folder should owned by root, only be writable by owner and readable by others.

controls.title: Server: Check sshd_config owner, group and permissions.
controls.desc: The sshd_config should owned by root, only be writable/readable by owner and not be executable.

controls.title: Server: Do not permit root-based login or do not allow password and keyboard-interactive authentication
controls.desc: Reduce the potential risk to gain full privileges access of the system because of weak password and keyboard-interactive authentication, do not allow logging in as the root user or with password authentication.

controls.title: Server: Specify the listen ssh Port
controls.desc: Always specify which port the SSH server should listen to. Prevent unexpected settings.

controls.title: Server: Specify the AddressFamily to your need
controls.desc: OpenSSH should be configured to the network family. Set it to inet if you use IPv4 only. For IPv6 only set it to inet6.

controls.title: Server: Specify ListenAddress
controls.desc: Limit the SSH server to listen to a specific address. Don't let it listen on all interfaces to avoid logins from unexpected sources.

controls.title: Server: Specify protocol version 2
controls.desc: Only SSH protocol version 2 connections should be permitted. Version 1 of the protocol contains security vulnerabilities. Don't use legacy insecure SSHv1 connections anymore.

controls.title: Server: Enable StrictModes
controls.desc: Prevent the use of insecure home directory and key file permissions.

controls.title: Server: Specify SyslogFacility to AUTH
controls.desc: Logging should be set to go to the /var/log/auth.log facility by using the SysLog AUTH parameter. This will ensure that any problems around invalid logins or the like are forwarded to a central security file for auditing purposes

controls.title: Server: Specify LogLevel to VERBOSE
controls.desc: Be verbose in logging, to allow analysis in case of unexpected behavior.

controls.title: Server: Specify SSH HostKeys
controls.desc: Specify HostKey for protection against Man-In-The-Middle Attacks

controls.title: Server: Specify UseLogin to NO
controls.desc: Disable legacy login mechanism and do not use login for interactive login sessions.

controls.title: Server: Use privilege separation
controls.desc: UsePrivilegeSeparation is an option, when enabled will allow the OpenSSH server to run a small (necessary) amount of code as root and the of the code in a chroot jail environment. This enables ssh to deal incoming network traffic in an unprivileged child process to avoid privilege escalation by an attacker.

controls.title: Server: Disable PermitUserEnvironment
controls.desc: Enabling environment processing may enable users to bypass access restrictions in some configurations using mechanisms such as LD_PRELOAD.

controls.title: Server: Specify LoginGraceTime
controls.desc: The LoginGraceTime gives the user 30 seconds to accomplish a login. This could be used to conduct a Denial of Service (DoS) against a running SSH daemon.

controls.title: Server: Specify Limit for maximum authentication retries
controls.desc: MaxAuthTries limits the user to three wrong attempts before the login attempt is denied. This avoid resource starvation attacks.

controls.title: Server: Specify maximum sessions
controls.desc: Specifies the maximum number of open sessions permitted per network connection. This could be used to conduct a Denial of Service (DoS) against a running SSH daemon.

controls.title: Server: Specify maximum startups
controls.desc: Limit the number of concurrent unauthenticated sessions to prevent Denial of Service (DoS) against a running SSH daemon.

controls.title: Server: Enable PubkeyAuthentication
controls.desc: Prefer public key authentication mechanisms, because other methods are weaker (e.g. passwords).

controls.title: Server: Disable IgnoreRhosts
controls.desc: Ignore legacy .rhosts configuration, because rhosts are a weak way to authenticate systems and provide attacker more ways to enter the system.

controls.title: Server: Enable IgnoreUserKnownHosts
controls.desc: This option is a weak way for authentication and provide attacker more ways to enter the system.

controls.title: Server: Disable HostbasedAuthentication
controls.desc: This option is a weak way for authentication and provide attacker more ways to enter the system.

controls.title: Server: Disable password-based authentication
controls.desc: Avoid password-based authentications.

controls.title: Server: Disable PermitEmptyPasswords
controls.desc: Accounts should be protected and users should be accountable. For this reason the usage of empty passwords should never be allowed.

controls.title: Server: Disable ChallengeResponseAuthentication
controls.desc: Avoid challenge-response and password-based authentications.

controls.title: Server: Disable Kerberos
controls.desc: Avoid kerberos authentication.

controls.title: Server: Disable Kerberos or Local Password
controls.desc: Avoid kerberos authentication because it use password-based authentication as fallback.

controls.title: Server: Enable KerberosTicketCleanup
controls.desc: Specifies whether to automatically destroy the user's ticket cache file on logout.

controls.title: Server: Disable GSSAPIAuthentication
controls.desc: If you do not use GSSAPI authentication then disable it.

controls.title: Server: Enable GSSAPICleanupCredentials
controls.desc: Automatically destroy the user's credentials cache on logout.

controls.title: Server: Disable TCPKeepAlive
controls.desc: Avoid the TCPKeepAlive messages to see if the client is still alive, because they are sent over unencrypted connection and are spoofable.

controls.title: Server: Set a client alive interval
controls.desc: ClientAlive messages are sent over encrypted connection and are not spoofable.

controls.title: Server: Configure a few client alive counters
controls.desc: This indicates the total number of checkalive message sent by the ssh server without getting any response from the ssh client. ClientAlive messages are sent over encrypted connection and are not spoofable.

controls.title: Server: Disable tunnels
controls.desc: Avoid to use tunnels.

controls.title: Server: Disable TCP forwarding
controls.desc: If you use TCP forwarding in an uncontrolled manner then you can bypass the firewalls

controls.title: Server: Disable Agent forwarding
controls.desc: Users with the ability to bypass file permissions on the remote host (for the agent's UNIX-domain socket) can access the local agent through the forwarded connection. An attacker cannot obtain key material from the agent, however they can perform operations on the keys that enable them to authenticate using the identities loaded into the agent.

controls.title: Server: Disable gateway ports
controls.desc: Prevent remote hosts from connecting to forwarded ports on the node.

controls.title: Server: Disable X11Forwarding
controls.desc: Prevent X11 forwarding by default, as it can be used in a limited way to enable attacks.

controls.title: Server: Enable X11UseLocalhost
controls.desc: SSH daemon should bind the X11 forwarding server to the loopback address. This prevents remote hosts from connecting to the proxy display and reduce the attack surface

controls.title: Server: Disable PrintMotd
controls.desc: This specifies that the SSH daemon itself should not read and display the message of the day file.

controls.title: Server: PrintLastLog
controls.desc: This tells the SSH daemon to print out information about the last time you logged in.

controls.title: Server: Banner
controls.desc: Specifies a banner file to serve before authentication succeeds

controls.title: Server: DebianBanner
controls.desc: Specifies whether to include OS distribution in version information

controls.title: Server: DH primes
controls.desc: Verifies if strong DH primes are used in /etc/ssh/moduli

controls.title: Verify the Windows folder permissions are properly set

controls.title: Operating system is up-to-date
controls.code:
control 'verify-patches' do
  impact 0.3
  title 'Operating system is up-to-date'
  describe linux_update do
    it { should be_uptodate }
  end
end

results.skip_message: Profile linux-patch-baseline is not supported on platform mac_os_x/17.7.0.

controls.title: All operating system patches are installed
controls.code:
control 'os-patches' do
  impact 0.3
  title 'All operating system patches are installed'
  linux_update.patches.each do |patch|
    describe patch do
      it { should be_nil }
    end
  end
end

control 'os-09' do
  impact 1.0
  title 'Check for .rhosts and .netrc file'
  desc 'Find .rhosts and .netrc files - CIS Benchmark 9.2.9-10'
  output = command('find / -maxdepth 3 \( -iname .rhosts -o -iname .netrc \) -print 2>/dev/null | grep -v \'^find:\'')
  out = output.stdout.split(/\r?\n/)
  describe out do
    it { should be_empty }
  end
end

controls.title: CPU No execution Flag or Kernel ExecShield
controls.desc: Kernel features and CPU flags provide a protection against buffer overflows. The CPU NX Flag and the kernel parameter exec-shield prevents code execution on a per memory page basis. If the CPU supports the NX-Flag then this should be used instead of the kernel parameter exec-shield.
controls.code:
control 'sysctl-33' do
  impact 1.0
  title 'CPU No execution Flag or Kernel ExecShield'
  desc 'Kernel features and CPU flags provide a protection against buffer overflows. The CPU NX Flag and the kernel parameter exec-shield prevents code execution on a per memory page basis. If the CPU supports the NX-Flag then this should be used instead of the kernel parameter exec-shield.'
  only_if { !container_execution }

  # parse for cpu flags
  flags = parse_config_file('/proc/cpuinfo', assignment_regex: /^([^:]*?)\s+:\s+(.*?)$/).flags
  flags ||= ''
  flags = flags.split(' ')

  describe '/proc/cpuinfo' do
    it 'Flags should include NX' do
      expect(flags).to include('nx')
    end
  end

  unless flags.include?('nx')
    # if no nx flag is present, we require exec-shield
    describe kernel_parameter('kernel.exec-shield') do
      its(:value) { should eq 1 }
    end
  end
end

profiles.name: ssl-baseline
profiles.title: DevSec SSL/TLS Baseline
profiles.summary: Ensures a secure configuration for TCP ports
profiles.copyright: DevSec Hardening Framework Team & Chef Software Inc.

options.description: Array of IPv4 and IPv6 Addresses to exclude
Array of TCP ports to exclude from SSL checking

controls.title: Inspec::Version=2.2.61
controls.code:
control 'debugging' do
  title "Inspec::Version=#{Inspec::VERSION}"
  impact 0.0
  describe "tcpports=\n#{tcpports.join("\n")}" do
    it { should_not eq nil }
  end
  describe "sslports=\n#{sslports.join("\n")}" do
    it { should_not eq nil }
  end
end

controls.title: Disable SSL 2 from all exposed SSL ports.
controls.code:
control 'ssl2' do
  title 'Disable SSL 2 from all exposed SSL ports.'
  impact 1.0
  only_if { sslports.length > 0 }

  sslports.each do |sslport|
    # create a description
    proc_desc = "on node == #{target_hostname} running #{sslport[:socket].process.inspect} (#{sslport[:socket].pid})"
    describe ssl(sslport).protocols('ssl2') do
      it(proc_desc) { should_not be_enabled }
      it { should_not be_enabled }
    end
  end
end
